title: extApps.xml file is unencrypted!!!
author: yossiuzan
body_snippet:
<!--
extApps.xml file is plain text and passwords can be extracted from there.
can the file be encrypted?
-->

comments.snippet:
To my knowledge, it has never been encrypted. Typically, when sensitive data (such as a password) is required, it is provided via a replacement parameter to the external app. So in the arguments text you might have `/p:%PASSWORD%`. Then, you can run that external app from a connection you define in your connection tree. This takes the password set in the connection (which is saved securely) and provides it to the external app.

If you have a use case where this does not work, or for some reaso...
